headline: Options on Solana and XRP Futures Begin Trading on CME
summary: CME Group began facilitating trades on Solana and XRP futures in March and May, respectively.

raw.headline: Options on Solana and XRP Futures Begin Trading on CME
raw.summary: CME Group began facilitating trades on Solana and XRP futures in March and May, respectively.

headline: CME Group and FTSE Russell Extend Index Derivatives License Through 2037
summary: CME Group, the world's leading derivatives marketplace, and FTSE Russell, the global index provider, today announced a 12-year extension of CME Group's exclusive license to offer futures, options on futures and OTC-cleared products based on FTSE Russell indexes.

raw.headline: CME Group and FTSE Russell Extend Index Derivatives License Through 2037

headline: Earnings Preview: CME Group (CME) Q3 Earnings Expected to Decline
summary: CME (CME) doesn't possess the right combination of the two key ingredients for a likely earnings beat in its upcoming report. Get prepared with the key expectations.

headline: Gold Futures Break $4,200 as Crypto Outflows Hit Record Levels
summary: Gold’s record surge and heavy crypto outflows signal a pivot by investors toward safe-haven assets ahead of the Federal Reserve’s Beige Book.

raw.headline: Gold Futures Break $4,200 as Crypto Outflows Hit Record Levels

headline: 3 Unpopular Stocks We Think Twice About
summary: When Wall Street turns bearish on a stock, it’s worth paying attention. These calls stand out because analysts rarely issue grim ratings on companies for fear their firms will lose out in other business lines such as M&A advisory.

headline: 2 Reasons to Avoid CME and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: CME Group currently trades at $267.06 per share and has shown little upside over the past six months, posting a middling return of 1.6%. The stock also fell short of the S&P 500’s 23.2% gain during that period.

raw.headline: 2 Reasons to Avoid CME and 1 Stock to Buy Instead

headline: Is CME Group’s (CME) Crypto Options Expansion Shaping Its Long-Term Growth and Client Mix?
summary: CME Group has launched CFTC-regulated options on Solana (SOL) and XRP futures, offering institutional traders physically settled contracts with daily, monthly, and quarterly expiries, available in both standard and micro sizes as of October 13, 2025. This expansion broadens CME's regulated crypto derivatives suite, addressing increased institutional demand for risk management tools and supporting the integration of established cryptocurrencies beyond Bitcoin and Ethereum into mainstream...
